results.title: Far away castle: music video by Sunwrae
results.creator_credit: Colin Chee and Multimedia Design, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology
results.brief_description:
A beautiful aesthetic piece of instrumental contemporary classical music, in rondo form (repetition of a single theme) with various tempi and expressions (music cycle). Colin Chee uses animation to portray music as both a life force and an escape from reality. Ethereal in style, movement and sound.
Music composed by Rae Howell or Sunwrae.

creators_primary.name: Multimedia Design, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology

results.title: Artist: unknown
results.brief_description:
Being a struggling artist is tough at the best of times but when you’re thousands of miles from home, your debts are mounting and you’re making no money, something’s got to give.
Amy made the long trip from Australia to London to paint. The rent on her workspace is now a month overdue, the landlord is knocking and working part-time in a cafe is not making ends meet. She could try selling her work - but that would entail showing people.
Shot on location in London with original music by Horse Stories. Produced, directed and written by Catherine Green.

results.title: Backthenrightnowlateron
results.creator_credit: Queensland Performing Arts Centre, David Megarrity and Luke Monsour
results.brief_description:
Mixing interviews, images and tiny fictions, “Backthenrightnowlateron” is a funny and moving collection of children’s thoughts on their past, present and future.
The work is divided into three segments - Backthen, Rightnow, Lateron. Each segment features children from Class 2J, Yeronga State School, with their favourite toy sharing their thoughts with interviewer Georgia Seffrin, and a mini-film starring one of the toys - Chicky goes to nana’s house, Red Ted goes to England, Minotaur goes to war. Provides a wonderful and amusing insight into young children’s minds.
Developed from an original concept and commission by QPAC’s “Out of the Box” Festival of Early Childhood for the OOTB Symposium, September 2003.

results.title: Stadium
results.brief_description:
Short experimental film capturing the atmosphere of Melbourne’s iconic MCG stadium at night whilst hosting a soccer match during the 2000 Sydney Olympics.
No commentary, using sound effects only.

results.title: The Two-wheeled time machine
results.creator_credit: Miriam Stein, David Lowe and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Henry Howard has discovered a way to stay young forever but life doesn’t seem worth living without his childhood sweetheart, Alice. Risking old age, Henry returns to convince her to join him.
Cast includes Matt Day as Henry, and Essie Davis as Alice (aged 19-35) and Jacki Weaver as Alice (49-76).

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: A young girl is given a video recorder as a gift. Structured as a video and super-8 diary, this compelling short film investigates the devastating effects on a child of adult secrets. This exceptional Australian short film is a first person narrative conveyed completely through point of view and mise-en-scene. Cast features Steve Jacobs and Lynette Curran.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - the Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. It uses a wide variety of commentators and visual and literary sources, and is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.
